SEARCH
Package org.hrw.hashing

Class Hasher

java.lang.Object
org.hrw.hashing.Hasher
public class Hasher extends Object
Performs hierarchical hashing of server telemetry data.

The Hasher converts incoming ServerRecord entries into a three-level hash structure:

  • secondHash – hash of a single record (one timestamp)
  • minuteHash – aggregation of all distinct second hashes within a minute
  • rootHash – aggregation of all minute hashes within a given interval (in minutes)

For each input record, a HashRecord is produced, containing the corresponding hash values. Aggregation is performed purely based on the timestamp (epoch seconds) passed with each record.

  • Method Details

    • hashData

      public List<HashRecord> hashData(List<ServerRecord> data)
      Computes hierarchical hash values for a list of ServerRecord entries.

      For each record:

      1. parses the timestamp (epoch seconds)
      2. computes a secondHash over the record contents
      3. aggregates second hashes into minuteHash at full-minute boundaries
      4. aggregates minute hashes into rootHash at interval boundaries
      5. creates a HashRecord with all three hash values

      Only new second hashes (not previously seen) within the current window are used for aggregation, to avoid duplication.

      Parameters:
      data - list of ServerRecord entries, each with a timestamp in epoch seconds
      Returns:
      list of HashRecord entries, or null if hashing fails

    • createEntryHash

      public String createEntryHash(String data) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Computes the hash for a single data record using the configured algorithm.
      Parameters:
      data - input string representation of the record
      Returns:
      hex-encoded hash string
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the configured algorithm is not available

    • createRootHash

      public String createRootHash(long timestamp) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Computes the root hash for the given timestamp.

      If the timestamp lies exactly on an interval boundary (timestamp % (interval * 60) == 0), all currently collected minuteHashes are aggregated into a new root hash and the internal minute list is cleared. Otherwise, an empty string is returned to indicate that no root hash is produced at this time.

      Parameters:
      timestamp - epoch seconds of the data point
      Returns:
      newly computed root hash, or an empty string if no aggregation is due
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException - if the configured algorithm is not available

    • createMinuteHash

      public String createMinuteHash(long timestamp) throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
      Throws:
      NoSuchAlgorithmException
